books.title: Winnie-the-Pooh
books.author: A. A. Milne
books.summary: A father tells stories to his son about the son’s stuffed animals come to life.

books.title: The Splendid Spur
books.author: Arthur Quiller-Couch
books.summary: Events force a young man to act for the Royalist side in the English Civil War, bringing many adventures in consequence.

books.title: Elizabeth and Her German Garden
books.author: Elizabeth von Arnim
books.summary: The English wife of a German aristocrat recounts, through a series of diary entries, a year spent revitalizing the neglected garden of their estate.

books.title: Personal Recollections of Joan of Arc
books.author: Mark Twain
books.summary: A fictional biography of Joan of Arc from her early teenage years to her martyrdom.

books.title: Catriona
books.author: Robert Louis Stevenson
books.summary: After coming into his fortune and evading his uncle’s schemes, young gentleman David Balfour continues his adventures in 18th century Scotland, helping a politically unwelcome friend escape into France, avoiding the hangman himself, finding his place as a gentleman in Edinburgh society, and falling in love with the daughter of a notorious Macgregor clansman.

books.title: School Stories
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: A collection of Wodehouse’s school stories about the lives and adventures of schoolboys in the early 1900s.

books.title: The Libation Bearers
books.author: Aeschylus
books.summary: A man is ordered by a god to avenge his father’s murder by killing his mother and her lover.

books.title: The Warlord of Mars
books.author: Edgar Rice Burroughs
books.summary: John Carter, an Earth-man transported to Mars, must rescue his beloved princess from imprisonment in the Martian Temple of the Sun.

books.title: The Woman in White
books.author: Wilkie Collins
books.summary: A young drawing teacher falls in love with his aristocratic pupil, who falls victim to a devious plot to acquire her considerable fortune.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Henry Kuttner
books.summary: A collection of short fiction by Henry Kuttner, ordered by date of original publication.

books.title: Commentaries on the Gallic War
books.author: Julius Caesar
books.summary: Julius Caesar’s account of the conflicts between Rome and Gaul in the later years of the Roman republic.

books.title: Mystery at Lynden Sands
books.author: J. J. Connington
books.summary: A Chief Constable’s holiday on the coast is interrupted when he is drawn into investigating a murder.

books.title: Yashka
books.author: Maria Bochkareva
books.summary: A Russian peasant leaves exile in Siberia to fight for her country in World War I.

books.title: What’s Wrong with the World
books.author: G. K. Chesterton
books.summary: Philosopher G. K. Chesterton comments on various social issues of his day, including property, imperialism, feminism, and education.

books.title: North of Boston
books.author: Robert Frost
books.summary: A collection of Frost’s poetry.

books.title: Candide
books.author: Voltaire
books.summary: A witty satire that tells of the young Candide’s attempts to stay optimistic through a series of incredible hardships.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Edgar Allan Poe
books.summary: A collection of Edgar Allan Poe’s short fiction, ordered by date of publication.

books.title: The Black Mask
books.author: E. W. Hornung
books.summary: The thieving duo of Raffles and Manders return in this second collection of A. J. Raffles short stories.

books.title: The Pilgrim Kamanita
books.author: Karl Gjellerup
books.summary: An Indian merchant’s son sets on a pilgrimage after a life of love, loss, business, and pleasure, and unknowingly relates his tale to the Buddha.

books.title: Three Men in a Boat
books.author: Jerome K. Jerome
books.summary: The humorous travelogue of a boating holiday down the Thames taken by three friends and their dog.
